page.title: 09HEALTH SERVICES
page.content: There are no doctors or dentists surgeries in the area, therefore people have to travel. A survey of 100 families was taken. The majority of people visit the doctors in Aspatria, which involves a journey of an average two miles each way. Visiting the dentist shows more variety, with 60% of the people going to Cockermouth, 15% to Wigton, 15% to Keswick, 5% to Maryport and 5% to Aspatria. This involves travelling anything up to twenty miles each way. There is a Health Visitor in the area, but her work is mainly with pregnant women, new babies and young children. Several of the old people have regular visits from District Nurses attached to doctors' practices, should they require regular treatments or care.
